name: Words With the Word Red in Them Online Trivia | Humanities | 10 Questions

questions.text: What four-letter word means to complete an action again?
questions.explanation:
redo.

	Re means again, so redo means to do again. Redo can also be defined as to make over, such as when someone redoes their house.

questions.text: If you tricked a person into doing something by making a false promise, what word would describe that?
questions.explanation:
lured.

	Synonyms of lured include enticed and tempted. Antonyms include deterred or put off.

questions.text: What word could you use to describe something that was badly damaged?
questions.explanation:
marred.

	Marred can also be used as an adjective which means imperfect. Synonyms of the verb include spoil and mutilate. A synonym of the adjective is scarred.

questions.text: This word means a metal support for the logs in a fireplace. What word is it?
questions.explanation:
firedog.

	When I first saw firedog I thought it meant a Dalmatian...that is the dog that rides on the firetruck. The firedog holds the wood still so that drafts go around it and don't put out the fire. They are also called andirons.

questions.text: What word can you use to say you acknowledge something as being good or worthy?
questions.explanation:
accredit.

	A synonym of accredit is to recognize. Many schools are accredited universities or colleges. This means they are credited as being good quality schools.

questions.text: This word is a list of what a religious group believes. What is this word?
questions.explanation:
credendum.

	Articles of faith is a synonym to credendum. Credendum should not be mixed up with agendum which is a list of things that are to be done.

questions.text: These people are big risk takers. What word am I thinking of?
questions.explanation:
daredevils.

	Evel Knievel is probably the best known daredevil. Knievel was born in Butte, Montana in 1938. He died from pulmonary problems in 2007. His son Robbie is also a daredevil.

questions.text: This word is a type of folkdance. What is it?
questions.explanation:
contredanse.

	In a contredanse the couples face each other in lines. It is also known as a country dance.

questions.text: When something is going to fail and one knows it before hand, what is the word that describes this?
questions.explanation:
foredoomed.

	When you sense failure is inevitable even though it hasn't happened yet, you could describe it as foredoomed.  If you take pains to make sure that something fails, you can be said to be foredooming it.

questions.text: If something does not get smaller it is what?
questions.explanation:
nonreducing.

	In natural numbers, once you get to 0 the numbers are nonreducing. That is you can't count backwards and still have positive integers.
